alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola; McKinley; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 26 at 9:44AM MST until February 26 at 10:30AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Cibola County in west central New Mexico... Western McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Western Catron County in west central New Mexico... Western San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 1030 AM MST. * At 942 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Twin Falls Arizona to near Luna New Mexico and was moving east to northeast. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 2 and 50. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 2 and 50. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 1 and 42. Locations impacted include... Gallup, Zuni Pueblo, Shiprock, Reserve, Luna, Kirtland, Quemado, Aragon, Brimhall Nizhoni and Black Rock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
